result.execSummary:
The defendant Haayden C. Seibel was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC [Modifiers: as a Party to a Crime], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Copy of Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission

Reserve Judge Nettesheim presiding for Branch IV:  
[MK] cases #15CF245 & #16CM184 called at 2:39pm. 
Defendant Haayden C. Seibel in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Initial Appearance is held in Case #16CM184 only:
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived
[Clerk MO take over at 2:45pm]

Atty Zarwell indicates that resolution has been reached in both cases.
DA Happ submits Amended Information for Case 15CF245
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "NO CONTEST" entered on Count #1 of the Amended Information of Case 15CF145 and Count #1 of Case 16CM184; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the plea, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.


On Count #1 of the Amended Information of Case 15CF145 and Count #1 of Case 16CM184, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 18 months, with conditions:

-- On 15CF245: to serve 20 days in the Jefferson County Jail, with work-release privileges, to commence on  5/6 /16 at  7:00 pm.
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to undergo assessment, treatment, therapy and counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--random drug and/or alcohol screening
--to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no possession of controlled substance without a valid prescription
--no contact with Andrew Bauer or any other known drug offender except for treatment purposes as deemed appropriate per agent
--to pay statutory costs; to include drug testing fees(joint and several with Andrew Bauer)


Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess: 305pm
Status conference on April 22, 2016 at 02:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF243, 15CF245 and 15CM259 called together at 1:09pm [mo]
Co-Defendant Andrew R. Bauer in court with attorney Karl Huebner.  
Co- Defendant Haayden C. Seibel in court with Attorney David Zarwell
ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Shock verifies victim rights on all cases

As to Case 15CF243:
Mr. Bauer waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

As to Case 15CF245:
Mr. Seibel waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

A Joint Request for Subsitution is filed; the Court approves the Substitution
ADA Shock files an Information in cases 15CF243 and 15CF245

recess in cases 15CF243 and 15CF245 at 1:16pm; Atty. Zarwell and Mr. Seibel exit the courtroom

As to Case 15CM259:
Atty. Huebner requests a status conference
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling.
recess: 1:20pm

NEXT: As to Case 15CM259: Status Conference on 4/5/16 at 10:30am
NEXT: As to Cases 15CF243 and 245: Judicial Assignment and schedule for Arraignment

Cases 15CM259, 15CF243 and 15CF245 called together at 9:50am [mo]
Co-Defendant Haayden C. Seibel in court with Attorney David Zarwell.   
Co-Defendant Andrew R. Bauer in court with Attorney Karl Huebner 
ADA Brookellen Teuber appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Atty. Zarwell requests a Preliminary Hearing be scheduled out 3 weeks
--Atty. Huebner agrees
--No Objection from ADA Teuber

The Court notes that 15CM259 will follow as a Status on the scheduled Preliminary Hearing date. 
recess: 9:58am

NEXT: As to All Cases: Preliminary Hearing/Status Conference on 1/12/16 at 1:00pm

]MK] cases #15CF243 & 15CF245, and case #15CM259 called at 2:37pm. 
Co-Defendant/Defendant Andrew R. Bauer in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. 
Co-Defendant Haayden C. Seibel in court with Attorney David Zarwell.  
DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
The State and both Mr. Bauer and Mr. Seibel waives Preliminary Hearing time limits in cases #15CF243 & #15CF245.
Attorney Huebner affirms the "not guilty pleas" and waives speedy trial in case #15CM259.
recess 
2:42pm. 

NEXT:   (1)  Pretrial Conference on 10/14/15 at 9:20am as to Mr. Bauer and at 9:40 as to Mr. Seibel  (2) Status Conference on 11/24/15 at 9:30am on all three cases

[MK] cases #15CF243 & 15CF245, and case #15CM259 called at 2:17pm. 
Co-Defendant/Defendant Andrew R. Bauer in court with Attorney Karl Huebner. 
Co-Defendant Haayden C. Seibel in court (PD counsel is being appointed for Mr. Seibel, however no PD counsel is available to appear with Mr. Seibel today). 
DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

As to all three cases: 
--Service of Complaints admitted, reading waived, the felony charges and maximum penalties are recited
--Both defendants verify that the dates of birth listed on the Complaints are correct. Mr. Bauer indicates that the address listed is correct, however Mr. Seibel provides a new address in Watertown) 
--the Court finds probable cause to exist in the Complaints 
--the Court adjourns the Initial Appearance in all three cases. 

As to Co-Defendant Bauer in Case #15CF243, Attorney Huebner indicates that the Defense is waiving Preliminary Hearing time limits. 
As to Case #15CM259:  pleas of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial is waived. 

The Court requires a $2500 Signature Bond in each case as to each Defendant , with conditions: 
--no possession or consumption of controlled substances without a valid prescription 
--no possession of drug paraphernalia 
--to take any prescribed medications only as prescribed
--no contact with the other Co-Defendant 

Additional conditions of Bond in case #15CF243 and #15CM259: 
--no operation of a motor vehicle without a valid drivers license
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Office for booking in case #15CM259
recess 2:29pm 

NEXT:   Adjourned Initial Appearance on all three cases on 9/22/15 at 2;00pm.
